tiles.name: Rocky Outcrop
tiles.description: A small rocky outcrop providing a slightly elevated view of the surrounding scrubland. Potential nesting site.

tiles.name: Sagebrush Patch
tiles.description: A dense patch of sagebrush, providing cover and potential nesting material for small creatures.

tiles.name: Barren Earth
tiles.description: A patch of barren earth, devoid of significant vegetation, marked with territorial markers.

tiles.name: Cacti Field
tiles.description: A small field of cacti, providing shelter and nesting sites for avian creatures. Limited water collection possible.

tiles.name: Scrubland Clearing
tiles.description: A dusty clearing in the scrubland, potentially used as an avian gathering spot. The landmark of the scrubland is visible in the distance.

tiles.name: Game Trail
tiles.description: A narrow game trail winding through the scrubland, used by rabbits and rodents.

tiles.name: Watering Hole
tiles.description: A small, hidden watering hole providing a vital water source in the arid climate.

tiles.name: Lone Joshua Tree
tiles.description: A lone, gnarled Joshua tree, a prominent landmark in the scrubland. Used as an avian lookout point.

tiles.name: Sagebrush and Rock
tiles.description: A small area of sagebrush and a small rock, where avian rituals are performed.
